New Records: Cade Cunningham tied Grant Hill for the longest triple-double streak in franchise history.
Cade Cunningham's fifth career triple-double tied Isiah Thomas for the second-most in franchise history.
Key Match Events: Cade Cunningham scored the winning basket with 8.5 seconds left to seal the game for Detroit.
Trae Young drove to the basket and dished the ball to Onyeka Okongwu, but Cade Cunningham blocked the shot as time expired.
The Hawks trailed by as many as 24 points in the first half but tied the game on Dyson Danielsâ€™ floater with 3:36 to play.
The Pistons led 99-88 early in the fourth quarter, but the Hawks tied the game with key plays by Larry Nance Jr.
The final score of the game was 122-121.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hawks struggled to provide much support for Trae Young until their final push.

The Pistons built their big first-half lead with minimal scoring from their best player, Cade Cunningham, who had seven rebounds and nine assists in the half but only scored two points on 1-for-6 shooting.
The Hawks outscored Detroit 98-82 in the final three quarters.
